Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Through this work we study how uncertainties in nuclear physics affect predictions about stellar evolution and nucleosynthesis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our goal is to understand better what can be learned from observations of stars and their remnants.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, it is well known that there exist large discrepancies between observed elemental abundance ratios in metal-poor halo stars and those predicted by standard models of galactic chemical evolution

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These differences may arise because some key nuclear processes have been poorly understood or not included in current evolutionary codes [2] , but they could also reflect systematic errors in observational data

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On order to address these issues, we perform detailed numerical simulations of massive star evolution with different sets of input parameters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Specifically, we consider two cases where the initial mass fraction of helium XHe = 0.25 and 0.30 respectively [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We evolve each model until its core collapses into a neutron star.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 During the collapse phase, we follow the hydrodynamics of the explosion as described in [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Afterwards, we compute the composition of the ejecta using an improved version [6] of the one-dimensional post-processing code developed originally by [7] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use two different sets for evolutionary tracks with varying Y values for masses between 0.8 M⊙ and 8 M⊙ at solar metallicity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first set is based on the Padova code while the second one uses the Geneva code.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These synthetic spectra were then used as input to determine the best-fit parameters of observed high-resolution optical spectra of Galactic open clusters.

 However, there are significant differences in the derived ages depending on which code was used.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This discrepancy can been explained by the fact that the Padova tracks have been calculated without convective overshooting whereas the Geneva tracks include this effect.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The problem of locating the source(s) of an acoustic emission (AE) event is addressed in this work by using a novel approach based on sparse representation and compressive sensing theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed method consists of two steps: first, AE signals were decomposed into several components via sparse coding; secondly, these components are used to estimate the locations of multiple AE events with high accuracy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to demonstrate its effectiveness, we apply our algorithm to simulated data as well as experimental results obtained from laboratory experiments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that the proposed method can locate multiple AE events accurately even when they occur at close time intervals or have similar waveforms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This article is part of a Special Issue entitled "Compressive Sensing for Industrial Applications" guest edited by Prof. Jianfeng Wu.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Introduction  Acoustic emission (AE) was defined as elastic waves generated within materials due to sudden localised releases of energy [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has been widely applied in non-destructive testing [2] , structural health monitoring [3] , geophysical exploration [4] , etc., where it provides useful information about material damage [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Has many practical applications such as industrial processes [6] , underground mining [7] , oil/gas pipeline inspection

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [8] , and so forth, there may be more than one AE source occurring simultaneously [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, accurate localisation of all AE sources becomes important [10] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, simultaneous AE sources often generate overlapping waveforms; thus conventional methods cannot distinguish them effectively [11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To address this issue, some researchers had attempted to use advanced signal processing techniques

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, Liu et al.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [15] developed the new method called 'time-frequency analysis' which was able to separate different AE sources successfully.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Nevertheless, their method requires prior knowledge about the number of AE sources present in each measurement channel.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, it also relies heavily on user experience to select appropriate parameters [16] .

 We study the transverse momentum dependence of J/ψ and Υ production cross sections at RHIC energies within an effective field theory approach, which includes both elastic scattering off quarks as well as inelastic processes such as dissociation into open charm or bottom hadrons.

 The latter turn out to become dominated by inelastic processes like dissociation into open heavy flavor mesons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we present results obtained within an effective field theory framework [4] , where the relevant degrees of freedom are quarks and gluons rather than individual hadronic states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This allows us to calculate the total cross section of quarkonium production in terms of elementary partonic subprocesses involving light quarks q = u, d, s and gluons g.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We present the results of our study on mass-loss rates in luminous blue variables (LBVs) based on radio observations at 1.4 GHz with the VLA, as well as optical spectroscopy obtained by us or taken from the literature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that LBV stars have typical mass-loss rates between 10^-6 M_sun/yr to 10^-4 M_sun/yr.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The mass-loss rate was found to be correlated with luminosity but not with stellar radius.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we report quasi-periodic modulations of radio supernovae associated with SN 1987A and SN 1993J which are likely due to periodic changes in their circumstellar environments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These variations may also explain why these two objects are observed to undergo large amplitude outbursts during their late stages.

 We present new results about the nature of dust extinction in external galaxies, based on observations with HST/ACS of type Ia supernovae (SNe) at redshifts z=0.1-0.7.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that SNe Ia are systematically bluer than expected if they were standard candles, but this effect is consistent with being due to dust extinction by interstellar material along their line-of-sight.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By addition we find evidence for an additional component of dust extinction which increases rapidly towards higher redshift.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This extra extinction may occur associated with the intergalactic medium surrounding galaxy clusters, or it could arise within individual galaxies as a result of recent star formation activity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These findings have important implications in cosmological studies using distant SNe Ia as distance indicators.

 Keywords: Galaxy cluster, Interstellar matter, Intergalactic medium, Redshift evolution, Supernova, Supernova Ia

 The main goal of this thesis is to experiment with the use of recursion as an alternative way for querying databases, using Prolog (a declarative language) and SQL (the standard query language).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first part presents some background on how databases become structured and queried today; it also introduces the concept of recursion and its application in computer science.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the second section we present our experiments with recursion in Prolog, where we show that recursion can be used to express complex queries without having to resort to procedural code or other languages such as Java.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, in the third section we discuss the results obtained by applying recursion in SQL systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We conclude that although there have been many attempts at implementing recursion in SQL systems, none has succeeded so far due to technical difficulties inherent in these systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work shows that recursion could be useful if implemented correctly in SQL systems.

 Keywords: Database, Recursion, Query

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The experimental results show that both TagRank and UserTagRank can significantly improve the performance of existing state-of-the-art techniques.

 The nature of generic cosmological singularities have been one of the most important open questions in theoretical physics for many years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular it is not known whether or not there are any physical processes that can take place at all times near the big bang (or equivalently near the big crunch).

 1 Introduction Stellar ages play a crucial role in many areas of astrophysics ranging from Galactic archaeology to exoplanet science.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, accurate ages are needed to understand how planets form and evolve over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, determining precise ages for individual stars remains challenging because they span several orders of magnitude in mass and luminosity and exhibit complex evolutionary histories.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, while main-sequence turn-off ages can been determined accurately through photometric techniques such as fitting theoretical isochrones to colour-magnitude diagrams (CMDs), these methods cannot become easily extended beyond the red giant branch where the effects of convection become important.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, even if asteroseismic observations allow us to probe the interiors of evolved stars, the interpretation of the resulting data requires detailed modelling of the structure and evolution of each star individually.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a result, other approaches must be explored to determine ages for large samples of stars spanning different stages of evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Gyrochronology provides another avenue for estimating ages based on the spin-down rate of magnetic activity cycles driven by dynamo processes operating at the base of the solar convective zone (Barnes 2003) .

 We report on the fluidization of a thin, horizontally vibrating granular bed by vertical oscillations at low frequency and amplitude.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The system is studied experimentally using high-speed video imaging in combination with particle tracking velocimetry (PTV).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that for sufficiently large vibration amplitudes, particles are ejected from the surface into the air as they reach their maximum height during an upward motion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This leads in the formation of a dilute gas phase above the dense packing near the bottom of the container.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we observe convection rolls which transport grains across the entire depth of the bed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results show striking similarities to those observed in vibrated beds of sand or glass beads but differ significantly from previous studies performed on systems where only horizontal vibrations were applied.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Vibrations may induce transitions between different states of matter such as solids, liquids, and gases [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, it has been shown that a solid state may become unstable when subjected to periodic forcing [2] , resulting in the spontaneous generation of traveling waves [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A particularly interesting case occurs if both horizontal and vertical components of the driving force act simultaneously [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we study the response of a thin granular layer to simultaneous application of horizontal and vertical vibrations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our experiments reveal new phenomena not seen before in other types of driven granular media.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that our model reproduces many observed trends, including the IR luminosity function and the correlation between star formation rate and dust temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, we also identify some discrepancies which suggest that further work was needed before this type of modelling can be used for detailed studies of individual objects or small samples.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main conclusions were summarised below:-The predicted number counts at 24 microns agree well with those measured by Spitzer/MIPS over most of the range probed by SINGS.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 -Our model predicts too few low-luminosity galaxies compared to the observations; however, these systems may not have been detected due to their extremely faint flux levels.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 -The predicted distribution of dust temperatures agrees reasonably well with the observations although there appears to be an excess of cold dusty galaxies in the simulations relative to what is seen in the data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 -The predicted relationship between far-infrared colour and total infrared luminosity agrees fairly well with the observations but shows signs of being slightly steeper than suggested by the data.

 We report on the adhesion force between two surfaces made out of the same material, which are caused by triboelectric charging and electrostatic attraction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The experiments are performed with silicon wafers in ambient air at room temperature using an atomic force microscope (AFM).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the measured adhesion force increases linearly with increasing normal load applied to the AFM tip.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This behavior can been explained by considering the contact area as well as the charge density distribution across this area.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For addition we show how the adhesion force depends on the relative humidity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible applications of our findings.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 These effects have been observed experimentally

 However, most studies so far focused upon dissimilar materials such as metals and insulators [9] .

 The present work is devoted to the study of some aspects of geometry and topology in relativistic cosmology, with particular emphasis on the role played by the Weyl tensor.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In Section 2 we review the basic concepts of Riemannian geometry that are relevant for our purposes; in particular, we introduce the concept of conformal vector field as well as its associated energy-momentum tensor.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also discuss how these fields can been used to construct exact solutions of Einstein's equations describing homogeneous but anisotropic universes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In Section 3 we consider the problem of classifying all possible types of singularities which may occur at finite time in spatially closed Friedmann-Robertson-Walker (FRW) models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This classification turns out to depend crucially upon whether or not the universe contains any matter sources other than radiation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, in Section 4 we show that the presence of a non-vanishing Weyl tensor leads to an additional type of singularity which cannot arise if one assumes that the universe consists only of ordinary matter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The data was obtained in 2006 and 2007, when the source was observed for about 100 ks each time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 1. Introduction     Open clusters provide an important tool for determining extragalactic distances because they contain many stars at nearly identical ages and chemical compositions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, open clusters can been found over a wide range of galactocentric radii, allowing us to probe different environments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, open clusters are relatively rare objects compared to field stars or globular clusters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, it is necessary to conduct surveys covering large areas of sky in order to obtain statistically significant samples of open clusters suitable for use as calibrators of the cosmic distance ladder.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Araucaria Project was initiated in 1998 with the goal of obtaining accurate distances to nearby galaxies via measurements of Cepheid variable stars associated with open clusters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This project uses data collected primarily by the Hubble Space Telescope's WFPC2 camera.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A total of eight fields were observed during Cycle 9-10 of the HST program.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Each field covers about 0.25 square degrees centered on a target galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For each field, deep exposures are obtained in both the F555W and F850LP bands.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that, for sufficiently large values of the driving amplitude, the system undergoes a phase transition into a state where it behaves as if it were made up by two coexisting phases with different densities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The low-density phase is characterized by a slow relaxation towards equilibrium which can be described within mean-field theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By contrast, the high density phase relaxes rapidly toward its stationary configuration.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This behavior resembles closely what happens during the freezing of colloidal suspensions driven out of equilibrium by an applied shear flow.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We introduce the concept of algebraic charge liquids, which are defined as ground states of Hamiltonians with local interactions that can be written in terms of fermionic creation and annihilation operators.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how to construct such models for any finite group G by using an explicit representation of G on the Hilbert space of spinless fermions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This resulting model is exactly solvable when G has no non-trivial subgroups.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this case we find that there exists at least one phase transition between different phases characterized by distinct topological orders.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if G = Z2 × Z2 then our construction yields two gapped phases distinguished by their chiral central charges c− = 0 or 1.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If G contains a nontrivial subgroup H then the system exhibits gapless excitations corresponding to particles transforming according to irreducible representations (irreps) of H.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results provide new insights in the classification problem of quantum many-body systems.

 We study the holographic entanglement entropy in three-dimensional de Sitter space with gravitational Chern-Simons term by using the replica trick and the covariant phase-space method.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that there is no logarithmic correction to the entanglement entropy, which agrees with previous results obtained via other methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we show that the first-order corrections are proportional to the square root of the volume enclosed by the entangling surface.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we calculate these second-order corrections and obtain an expression containing two terms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One of them has been previously found in Ref.

 The latter can be written as a sum over all possible contractions between the Riemann tensor and its derivatives at the boundary points.

 This result shows that the gravitational Chern-Simons coupling constant plays a role similar to the Newton's constant in four dimensions.

 We present an optimal design method to find the best occulting mask that can be used in direct imaging searches for extrasolar planets.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed method is based on the concept of entropy maximization, which has been widely applied in many fields such as information theory and statistical mechanics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this concept can get extended into the field of optics by introducing a new quantity called optical entropy (OE).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By using OE we are able to quantify the amount of information contained within each point spread function produced by different masks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This allows us to determine the most efficient mask shape with respect to its ability to detect faint companions around bright stars.   .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [more]  In order to demonstrate our approach, we have performed numerical simulations to compare the performance of several candidate masks against one another.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results indicate that the proposed method provides significant improvement over existing methods when it comes to finding the optimal mask shapes for detecting faint companions around bright host stars.

 The Casimir effect is one of the most important manifestations of quantum vacuum fluctuations and has been studied extensively for more than 50 years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The original prediction was made by H.B.G. Casimir, who showed that two parallel uncharged conducting plates attract each other with an attractive force inversely proportional to the fourth power of their separation distance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this work we study how the magnitude of the Casimir force depends on the optical properties of the boundaries between which it acts.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider three different cases corresponding to (i) perfectly reflecting mirrors, (ii) dielectric mirrors, and (iii) metallic mirrors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In all these cases we calculate numerically the Casimir energy density using the Lifshitz theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that the Casimir force acting between two identical mirrors can be either repulsive or attractive depending on whether they are separated by air or water.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This behavior arises due to the fact that the reflection coefficients at the mirror surfaces depend strongly on the surrounding medium.

 The aim of this article is to present the basic concepts in Riemannian geometry that is needed for understanding the main results presented here.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first section introduces some notation and definitions used throughout the text.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we define what it means for two points on an n-dimensional manifold M to be close together (in terms of geodesic distance) or far apart.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also introduce the concept for a local coordinate system at each point p ∈ M which allows us to describe any other point q near p by giving its coordinates with respect to these local charts.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we give a brief description of how one might construct such a coordinate system locally around a given point using parallel transport along curves starting at p.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The second section describes the notion of a vector field X defined over all of M.   This was done by defining a map F : T M → R where T M denotes the tangent bundle of M.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then we show that if X satisfies certain conditions then there exists a unique smooth function f : M → R such that X = grad(f).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here grad(f) denotes the gradient for f.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if M is a surface embedded in R3 then X could represent the velocity of a particle moving across M.   If we assume that the particles move according to Newton's laws of motion then the function f would correspond to the potential energy of the system under consideration.

 The third section defines the concept of a tensor field as a generalization of vector fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Tensor fields allow us to associate several vectors.

 We propose that the two branches in the mass distribution of neutron stars are due to different mechanisms for their formation, with one branch being formed by accretion-induced collapse (AIC) of white dwarfs into neutron stars, while another is formed through core-collapse supernovae (CCSNe).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this scenario could explain both the existence of massive pulsars as well as the absence of such objects in the observed sample of CCSNe remnants.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed model also explains why here have been no successful attempts so far at detecting gravitational waves emitted during AIC events.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By addition we argue that our model provides an explanation for the apparent discrepancy between the masses inferred from observations of binary systems containing black holes or neutron stars on one hand, and those inferred from measurements of the radii of isolated neutron stars on the other.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible observational tests which could been used to verify our hypothesis.

 We present new results on the formation of bipolar lobes by an expanding, rotating surface explosion (a "rotating detonation").

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use two-dimensional hydrodynamic simulations to show that such explosions can form disks with large opening angles if they are not too energetic or fast-expanding.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The disk is formed because the outer layers of the star are swept up into a thin shell as it expands outward at high speed; this shell then breaks apart due to Rayleigh-Taylor instabilities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As the shell fragments, material falls back onto the central region of the exploded star forming two opposite jets which break out along the poles of the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These jets drive the expansion in the bipolar lobes.

 We present the first detection with relativistically modulated X-ray fluxes from the Galactic Center black hole candidate SgrA*, using data obtained with Chandra and XMM-Newton observatories over an eight-year period (2000-2007).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observed light curves show clear periodic dips on time scales ranging between 20 minutes to several hours that are consistent with being caused by general relativistic effects near the event horizon of this supermassive black hole.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find no evidence for long-term variability or flaring activity during these observations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results provide strong support for theoretical models where the emission was produced close to the last stable orbit around the central black hole via accretion disk instabilities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Introduction Galaxies are complex systems whose properties depend strongly on their mass, age, chemical composition, star formation history, and environment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These physical characteristics determine many observable quantities such as luminosity, colours, morphology, kinematics, etc., which have been studied extensively over several decades.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it has become clear recently that there exist significant degeneracies between some of these observables and therefore they cannot be uniquely determined without additional information about the underlying physics or geometry of the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, the total luminosity of a galaxy depends not only on its current star formation rate but also on its past star formation activity through the integrated light of old stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Similarly, the colour of a galaxy depends both on its metallicity and on the amount of dust extinction along our line-of-sight.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, accurate measurements for all relevant physical parameters require detailed spectroscopic observations covering large wavelength ranges.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such studies are now possible thanks the new space missions like GALEX, SDSS, 2MASS, Spitzer Space Telescope, Herschel Space Observatory, Chandra X-ray Observatory, XMM-Newton, Hubble Space Telescope, and most importantly, the upcoming European Space Agency's Gaia satellite.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Gaia is expected to provide astrometric positions, parallaxes, proper motions, radial velocities, and multi-colour photometry for more than one billion objects

 We study the message throughput performance of dynamic peer-to-peer systems with unreliable links and limited bandwidth, where peers were connected to each other via overlay networks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We propose two models for such systems: (1) an analytical model based on mean field theory; and (2) a simulation-based model that was built upon ns-2 network simulator.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results show that our proposed models can accurately predict the message throughput under different settings.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we compare the message throughputs achieved by three popular overlay routing protocols: flooding, random walk, and epidemic routing.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our findings suggest that flooding achieves higher message throughput than both random walk and epidemic routing when there exists only one source-destination pair.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, if multiple pairs exist simultaneously, then epidemic routing outperforms flooding because it allows messages to be forwarded along multiple paths at once.

 The effect of three different sugars (trehalose, maltase and sucrose) on the structure and dynamics of lysozyme has been investigated by molecular dynamics simulation at 300 K for 100 ns in each case.

 However, the best fit parameters are found to be consistent within their errors when compared with each other.

 Using our multi-wavelength data set, we estimate the total energetics associated to this event to be ~3 x 1044 erg.

 We present new exact solutions to the Einstein field equations for stationary axisymmetric spacetimes with two commuting Killing vectors, which are generated by applying nonholonomic frame transforms (NFT) to known vacuum solutions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The NFT is constructed using an ansatz for the metric coefficients that depends on one arbitrary function of the radial coordinate only.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this method can been used to generate families of black hole solutions with different horizon topologies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we find new rotating black ring solutions with toroidal horizons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These solutions have been obtained previously as limits of static black rings but our approach allows us to obtain them directly without any additional assumptions or approximations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss some open problems related to these results.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The study of exact solutions to the Einstein equations has played a crucial role in understanding many aspects of general relativity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it is often difficult to construct such solutions as they require solving complicated nonlinear partial differential equations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This problem becomes even more challenging when considering physically interesting situations than those involving rotation and/or matter fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Nevertheless, there exist several techniques that allow one to generate new classes of solutions starting from simpler ones.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One of the most powerful methods involves transforming the original solution into another one via so-called nonholonomic frame transforms [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such transformations preserve certain geometric properties of the spacetime while changing others; see [2] -

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [4] for reviews.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if the transformed solution satisfies the vacuum Einstein equations then so does the original one [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this work we apply nonholonomic frame transforms to known vacuum solutions of the Einstein equations in order to generate new exact solutions describing stationary axisymmetric spacetimes: i.e., spacetimes admitting at least two independent Killing vector fields whose orbits are closed curves [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Stationary axisymmetric spacetimes play an important role in astrophysics because they describe the exterior gravitational field of spinning objects like stars, planets, and black holes

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Karlsruhe Tritium Neutrino experiment (KATRIN) is currently under construction at the Karlsruhe Institute for Technology, Germany.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It can measure the electron energy spectrum near the endpoint with unprecedented precision by using an electrostatic retardation spectrometer combined with a magnetic filter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The measurement aims at determining the absolute value of the effective electron antineutrino mass mneff with a statistical uncertainty of 0.2 eV/c2 or better.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With this contribution we present results on the expected sensitivities of KATRIN to mneff as well as to possible contributions from right-handed currents in beta-decay.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that these sensitivities are mainly determined by systematic uncertainties which can be controlled within the experimental accuracy required.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This allows us to conclude that KATRIN has excellent prospects to determine mneff precisely enough to test whether it agrees with the predictions of standard model extensions such as supersymmetry.

 We present an extension of the standard model that includes gravity, based on Feynman's ideas about quantum gravity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The extended standard model was formulated in terms of gauge fields for all known interactions (including gravity) and fermions with spin 1/2 or 1.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this theory can be derived from first principles using Feynman diagrams.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we discuss some phenomenological consequences such as neutrino masses and dark matter candidates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we comment briefly about possible experimental tests of our proposal.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work was supported by NSF grant PHY-0456747.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A theory of everything would include gravity along with other fundamental forces.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we propose one such theory which extends the standard model of gravitational effects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our approach follows closely Feynman's original idea of formulating quantum gravity in terms of gauge fields coupled to fermions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using Feynman diagrams we derive the extended standard model from first principles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Some phenomenological consequences are discussed, e.g., neutrino mass generation via seesaw mechanisms and dark matter candidates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Affinity propagation (AP) is an algorithm for clustering that has been shown to be effective in many applications, including bioinformatics and computer vision.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, AP requires the number of clusters as input parameter which may not always been known beforehand.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this work we propose a novel approach based on constrained optimization techniques to automatically determine the optimal number of clusters using only pairwise similarity information between samples.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how our method can been applied to several problems related to gene expression analysis such as finding co-expressed genes or identifying differentially expressed genes across multiple conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results demonstrate that our proposed method outperforms state-of-the-art approaches both in terms of accuracy and robustness.

 However, one disadvantage of AP is that it requires the user to specify the desired number of clusters k before running the algorithm.

 To overcome this problem, some authors have suggested heuristics to estimate the value of k

 Nevertheless, these solutions still require the user to provide additional parameters for the maximum allowed cluster size [7] or the minimum required density

 We find that most (80%) of our sample are oblate spheroids, while 20% have more complex morphologies including prolate spheroids, disks, or bipolar structures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The majority of these objects show no evidence for rotation; however, we can detect significant polarization vectors aligned perpendicular to the major axes of several sources which may be due to magnetic fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Twenty percent exhibit more complicated morphologies such a prolate spheroids or bipolar structures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Most of these objects appear to lack any internal rotation but some display polarization vectors oriented perpendicularly to their major axes suggesting the presence of magnetic fields.

 We present an algorithm to solve the half-space depth problem, which is one of the most fundamental problems in computational geometry.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The input consists of n points on the plane with integer coordinates bounded by B.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We want to find a point that minimizes its distance to all other points.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This problem has become studied extensively since it was introduced by Helly in 1930s.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this work we propose a new branch-and-cut algorithm based on mixed-integer programming (MIP) formulation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our MIP model uses O(nB) variables as constraints.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using our proposed cutting planes, we could reduce the number of nodes explored during search significantly.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In a result, our algorithm runs faster than existing algorithms when the dimension d = 2 or 3.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if the dimension is two, then our algorithm solves instances with up to 1 million points within 10 minutes while previous best known results were limited to 100 thousand points.

 We found that there was an increase in the value of property sales during the period analyzed, but it did not reach levels considered as bubbles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, the results show that the LV real estate market has experienced periods of overvaluation since 2007.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, our findings suggest that the ARIMAX model can be useful when predicting the evolution of the CSWI indexes.

 This was done for any commutative ring with unity R (not necessarily Noetherian).

 The author considers the problem of gravitational interaction between bodies in terms of their informational content.

 The main idea is that the gravitational field can be considered as an ensemble of gravitons which carry information about the source body.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, there appears to exist some correlation between flux variations in hard energies (> 4 keV) and those in softer energies (< 4 keV), although it does not appear to be strictly linear relationship.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result suggests that the origin of the short-term variability may be due to reprocessing of harder photons into softer ones rather than intrinsic fluctuations of the primary source itself.

 In this work, we propose an energy-efficient cooperative transmission scheme for wireless sensor networks (WSNs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed scheme is based on the combination of collaborative beamforming at the source node with cooperative transmission to multiple relay nodes in order to improve lifetime performance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, the source node first transmits data packets using its maximum power level.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, it switches to lower power levels if no packet has was successfully received within a certain time period.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If one or more packets are successfully decoded, then the source node increases its transmit power back up to the previous value.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We derive closed-form expressions of outage probability as well as average throughput under Rayleigh fading channels.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that our proposed scheme can significantly increase network lifetime compared to conventional schemes without compromising system reliability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, numerical examples are provided to verify the theoretical analysis.

 Keywords: Lifetime improvement; Relay selection; Energy efficiency; Outage probability

 We present an exact quantum-mechanical treatment for the dynamics of open systems in which the system is coupled to many harmonic oscillators representing its surrounding environment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that, under certain conditions, this model can be reduced exactly into a master equation with Lindblad form.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting master equations were used to study the effects of environmental fluctuations on the evolution of the density matrix describing the state of the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we consider two different models of environments corresponding to Ohmic dissipation and spin-boson interaction respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For both cases it is shown how the effect of the environment leads to irreversible loss of information about the initial state of the system as well as to thermalization at late times.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible applications for our results to problems such as transport through mesoscopic conductors or dissipative tunneling between localized states in disordered solids.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Decoherence and relaxation processes play a crucial role in understanding the physics of open quantum systems

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These phenomena arise when the system interacts with some external degrees of freedom (environment) whose influence cannot be neglected [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years there has been considerable interest in developing theoretical methods capable of treating these effects beyond the perturbative regime [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A number of approaches have been proposed ranging from phenomenological treatments based on stochastic Schrödinger equations [5] , to more microscopic descriptions using path integral techniques [6] or field-theoretical formulations [7, 8] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite their successes, all these methods suffer from one common drawback: they may not provide any insight into the underlying physical mechanisms responsible for decoherence and relaxation; nor do they allow us to make quantitative predictions regarding the time scales involved [9] .

 Recently, several authors [10 -12] have suggested that the problem may be tackled within the framework of quantum mechanics itself.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This idea is first put forward by Feynman

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [13] who showed that the statistical properties of macroscopic objects could been obtained by averaging over an ensemble of identical but microscopically distinct realizations of the same experiment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 More recently, Leggett [14] introduced the method.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The transformation preserves all communication complexity measures such as round-complexity or number of messages exchanged between parties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we give examples where our approach is useful by applying it to prove security of several well-known protocols.

 In recent years there has been much interest in developing techniques for analyzing the security of cryptographic protocols.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One important goal is to develop tools for showing whether certain protocols are secure with respect to various definitions of security.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, many researchers had studied the problem of transforming a protocol secure only against passive attackers into one secure against active attackers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This problem is first considered by Canetti et al., who gave a general solution based on universal composability

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However their method did not preserve communication complexity measures like round-complexity or message-exchange patterns.

 Subsequently, Micali proposed another transformation [MIC02] , but his technique requires additional assumptions about the underlying primitives being used.

 We present an analysis of the effects that mergers may have on scaling relations between black holes (BHs), galaxies, and other gravitationally bound systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use cosmological simulations to study how BH mass is related to galaxy properties in different merger histories.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Finally, we demonstrate how our results may be used to describe experiments on spinor condensates loaded into optical lattices.

 We consider the problem of power allocation in discrete-input delay-limited fading channels with multiple users and time-varying channel gains.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed algorithm can be implemented efficiently through parallel processing at each iteration step.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, efficient resource allocation strategies should take into account all relevant factors so as to maximize overall network utility [5] .

 Nevertheless, their solutions either require high computational complexity

 We present an analysis of N-body simulations aimed at understanding how evaporation shapes the mass function (MF) of globular clusters (GCs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that, in agreement with previous studies, evaporation causes GCs to lose stars preferentially on their low-mass end and thus steepens the MF slope towards lower masses.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, we show that this effect is counteracted by two competing processes: dynamical friction which removes massive stars more efficiently than less massive ones; and relaxation-driven core collapse which increases the central density of the cluster and makes it harder for massive stars to escape.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The net result depends strongly on the initial concentration of the cluster, but typically leads to shallower slopes compared to those observed in real GCs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that other processes were required to explain the shape of the observed MF.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, our results suggest that primordial binaries may be responsible for producing the high-mass power-law tail seen in many GCs.

 We introduce the notion of an algebra over a monoidal category and show that it is equivalent to the notion of a coalgebra in the dual category, which we call a comonoid.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We then define the cyclic homology of such algebras as the Hochschild cohomology of their underlying comonoids with coefficients in the bimodule given by the tensor product of the algebra with its opposite algebra.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This definition generalizes the usual one of ordinary algebras over fields or rings.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, if the base ring has characteristic zero, this recovers the classical definitions of cyclic homology and periodic cyclic homology.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The same construction also works for Hopf algebroids instead of ordinary algebras;  however, there are some subtleties arising when trying to extend these results to arbitrary commutative rings.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 [Bök] , who showed how they could get used to construct new algebraic structures like crossed modules and group extensions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, both of them can be computed explicitly in terms of the structure maps defining the cyclic object.

 The origin of the most massive stars is still an open question in astrophysics, as well as their role in shaping galactic evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These YMCs have masses up to 10^8 Msun and sizes of ~1kpc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They appear to be very compact compared with local starburst galaxies such as Arp 220 or M82 which typically contain much less dense stellar populations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the observed size-mass relation of these distant YMCs agrees remarkably well with predictions based on numerical simulations of turbulent gas clouds collapsing under self-gravity.

 We report on the measurement of electric fields produced by surface contaminants using neutral atoms as probes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The technique was based on measuring the Stark shift in atomic resonance lines due to an applied electric field, and has been used previously for studying electric fields near surfaces such as those found at liquid helium temperatures or in high vacuum environments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have extended this method to measure electric fields over a wide range of temperatures (4 K - 300 K) and pressures (10-6 Torr - atmospheric pressure).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we demonstrate that it can be used to study electric fields generated by charged particles trapped close to surfaces.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work opens up new possibilities in probing electric fields in many different systems including biological samples where conventional techniques are limited.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Measurement of electric fields produced by charged particle traps using neutral atoms: A novel probe of local electrostatic potentials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Measuring electric fields produced by surface contaminant.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Neutral atoms provide a unique tool for investigating electric fields because they respond directly to the vector potential associated with electromagnetic fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we use this property to measure electric fields produced from surface contamination.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our approach relies upon observing the Stark splitting of atomic energy levels when exposed to external electric fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Previous experiments have demonstrated this effect in low temperature and ultra-high vacuum conditions1-5 but here we show how these measurements may also been performed under more typical laboratory conditions.

 We report the discovery and characterization of USco 1606-1935, an unusually wide low-mass triple system with two M-dwarfs orbiting each other in a ~2 year period at a distance of about 100 AU (~33 light years).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The third component is a late K-type star that orbits both stars on a much wider scale, with a minimum mass for this companion of 0.7 solar masses.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present near-infrared spectroscopy to determine the spectral types for all three components as well as their radial velocities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that the inner binary has a total mass of only 0.3 solar masses, making it one of the lowest-mass binaries known.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This makes USco 1606-1935 an ideal target for future studies of planet formation around very-low-mass stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we find evidence for significant orbital eccentricity in the outer orbit which may be caused by tidal interactions between the close pair and its distant tertiary companion.

 We consider the statistical properties of nonstationary random acoustic and electromagnetical waves in terms of their correlation functions, power spectra, and probability density functions (PDFs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that these quantities can be expressed by means of solutions to certain partial differential equations with time-dependent coefficients.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The PDFs were obtained for both stationary and nonstationary cases using the method of characteristics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we derive an exact expression for the PDF of the amplitude fluctuations of a monochromatic plane wave propagating through a turbulent medium.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result was used to obtain expressions for the mean-square fluctuation levels of the electric field strength and intensity at any point along the propagation path.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss some applications for our results to radiowave scintillation theory and radar detection problems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the generation of large-scale magnetic fields in astrophysical plasmas with very small values of the magnetic Prandtl number, Pm = ν/η ≪ 1 (ν is viscosity, η is resistivity).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider two different types of flows that are relevant for this problem -helically driven turbulence and convection-driven turbulence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In both cases we find that the mean electromotive force has contributions from several terms which scale differently as functions of the Reynolds number Re = UL/ν and the magnetic Reynolds number Rm = URm/η.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here U , L, and Rm are characteristic velocity, length, and magnetic field scales respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For helically driven turbulence these contributions can been grouped into three categories:  The first category includes all terms proportional to Re(Rm)−1/2 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These terms have been studied previously by many authors using various approaches including direct numerical simulations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They represent the contribution to the so-called α-effect due to helical motions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The second category contains all terms proportional to Re1/2 (Rm)−1/4 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This term represents the effect of helicity on the nonlinear evolution of the magnetic fluctuations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, there exists also an additional third category containing all terms proportional to Re3/4 (Rm)−3/8 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It describes the influence on helicity on the linear growth rate of the magnetic fluctuations.

 We present the radio through X-ray spectral energy distributions (SEDs) for 38 quasars with broad absorption lines in their optical spectra, selected from the Sloan Digital Sky Survey Data Release 5 quasar catalog and observed by Chandra and/or XMM-Newton.

 We find that these sources are typically characterized by steep radio to infrared continua, weak or absent emission lines at ultraviolet wavelengths, and strong soft excesses below 1 keV.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The rate at which new mutations become fixed in populations is determined by the balance between natural selection and genetic drift, but how these forces interact to shape the evolution of proteins remains poorly understood.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we show that neutral genetic drift can accelerate the fixation of beneficial mutations within genes encoding functionally important regions of proteins.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We used deep mutational scanning to measure the fitness effects on all possible single amino acid substitutions for two enzymes (T4 lysozyme and TEM-1 β-lactamase) across their entire sequence space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By combining this data with population genetics simulations, we found that neutral genetic drift increased the probability of fixing beneficial mutations in both enzymes' active sites.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This effect was particularly pronounced when the number of adaptive mutations available per generation was low or when there were many competing deleterious mutations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results suggest that neutral genetic drift may play an underappreciated role in shaping the evolution of proteins.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The effect of light quanta on the physiological response of seedlings subjected to nickel (Ni2+) stress were investigated in this study.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results showed that the growth and photosynthetic characteristics were significantly affected by different treatments, especially when exposed to high concentration of Ni2+ for 24 h. Compared with control group, the shoot length decreased by 39% under 100 μM Ni2+ treatment; however, it increased by 20% after exposure to red light (RL).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By addition, the root length also reduced by 44% compared with control plants but increased by 25% following RL illumination.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, the chlorophyll content per unit leaf area declined by 42% due to Ni2+ toxicity while it increased by 34% as a result of RL application.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, the net photosynthesis rate (Pn), stomatal conductance (gs), intercellular CO2 concentration (Ci), transpiration rate (Tr), and water use efficiency (WUE) all decreased to 46%, 49%, 50%, 51%, and 53% respectively at 100 μM Ni2+ treated plants whereas they increased by 29%, 28%, 30%, 31%, and 32% respectively upon exposure to RL.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These findings suggested that the effects of Ni2+ toxicity could been alleviated through the application of RL.

 We present the results of an analysis to determine rates, masses, spins, and luminosities for intermediate mass ratio inspiral (IMRI) events detectable with advanced gravitational wave detectors such as Advanced LIGO.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use Monte Carlo simulations to generate IMRIs of galactic binaries that are consistent with current observations of binary pulsars and X-ray binaries.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The simulated systems evolve in three phases: detached phase, Roche lobe overflow phase, and common envelope phase.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In our simulation we assume that all stars have solar metallicity and initial spin periods of 10 days.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With each system generated, we calculate its signal-to-noise ratio using the stationary phase approximation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that there will be about one event per year within 100 Mpc with signal-to-noise ratios greater than 8.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is comparable to the rate expected for double neutron star mergers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, unlike double neutron star mergers which occur at high redshifts, most IMRI events should be detected nearby.

 The Kuiper belt is the source region of most short period comets, but its formation remains poorly understood.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present results from N-body simulations that show how collisions among planetesimals in Neptune's feeding zone could produce objects with orbits similar to those observed today.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The initial conditions are based on models of planet migration during which Neptune migrated outward by about 30 AU before being halted at its current location.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This process produced a population of small bodies with orbital eccentricities ranging up to 0.3.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Subsequent encounters with Neptune caused some of these bodies to become scattered into highly eccentric orbits.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results provide an explanation for why there appears to be no correlation between the size distribution of KBOs and their orbital eccentricity.

 We consider the problem of designing distributed consensus algorithms in sensor networks where links are randomly generated and can be lost or added over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We propose an algorithm that is robust to link failures, but requires only local information exchange between neighboring nodes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed algorithm achieves global convergence with mild conditions on network topology.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we show that if each node has at least one neighbor whose degree is greater than its own then our algorithm converges almost surely (a.s.) to the correct value.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results also hold when there exists a small number of Byzantine nodes which may deviate arbitrarily from their prescribed behavior.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, numerical simulations demonstrate the effectiveness in our approach.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Keywords: Sensor Networks; Distributed Consensus; Local Information Exchange; Robustness Analysis.

 The Standard Model is in excellent agreement with all current experimental data, but it leaves many questions unanswered and fails to provide an explanation for some phenomena observed experimentally.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We report scanning magnetoresistance microscopy (SMRM) measurements on an atom chip with gold wires and microtraps fabricated by focused ion beam milling.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The SMRM images show the magnetic field distribution in the vicinity of the wire structures, which is used to transport cold atoms between different trapping sites.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the magnetic fields generated by these wires can become accurately described using Biot-Savart's law for straight current-carrying conductors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we observe small deviations from this model at distances below 100 nm from the surface of the wires.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These deviations may arise due to stray currents induced in the substrate or due to nontrivial geometries of the wires close to their surfaces.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results demonstrate that SMRM is well suited to study complex magnetic field distributions near microscopic objects such as atom chips.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Atom chips have been developed over recent years as miniaturized devices for manipulating neutral atomic matter waves

 [3] , where ultracold atoms are transported along the wires before being trapped in the microtraps

 However, direct measurement techniques like SQUID-based magnetometry [5] cannot resolve the magnetic field distribution inside the wires because they are too thin [6] .

 Therefore indirect methods based on imaging the trajectories of atoms released from traps

 [7, 8] or measuring the forces acting on them [9] are employed instead.

 We show that the Pioneer anomaly, which is an anomalous acceleration observed in radio tracking data for two spacecrafts launched by NASA (Pioneer 10/11), can be explained if we assume that there exists a conformal symmetry breaking effect at large distances from our solar system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also argue that this effect may lead to accelerating expansion of the universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The idea behind these results was based on the fact that the space-time metric around massive bodies has been shown to have a certain degree of anisotropy due to quantum gravity effects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This anisotropic nature in space-time leads to violation of Lorentz invariance, which in turn causes violations of energy-momentum conservation laws.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to explain such violations within the framework of general relativity one needs to introduce new fields into the theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These are called "dark fields" because they do not interact with ordinary matter but only affect gravitational interactions between particles.

 We report on an exceptional flare detected by Swift/XRT at t ~ 1 day post-burst, which lasted for more than 100 ks (~20 hr).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The flare was followed up with observations performed with XMM-Newton/EPIC-pn between 2.5 days to 3 months post-burst.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that this flare is best described as a superposition of two components: one component lasting about 50 ks peaking around 10^-3 s and another component lasting about 70 ks peaking around 5 x 10^4 s. Both components are well fitted by exponentially cut-off power-laws with photon indices Γ = -1.6 ± 0.1 and -2.2 ± 0.3 respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The question is not new, but it has been recently revived by the publication of two papers in Nature and Science that claim to show that biodiversity loss leads to ecosystem collapse.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The authors argue that this finding should been taken seriously because ecosystems are essential for human well-being.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They also point out that there have been many previous studies showing that biodiversity loss can lead to declines in ecosystem functioning (e.g., productivity) without necessarily causing an abrupt change in state or collapse.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this article we review these recent findings on biodiversity-ecosystem function relationships as well as some earlier results suggesting that biodiversity may sometimes enhance rather than reduce ecosystem stability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We conclude with a discussion about how our understanding of biodiversity-ecosystem function interactions could be improved through further research.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Biodiversity loss is one of humanity's greatest challenges today.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It threatens the sustainability of natural resources used directly by humans such as food production systems and water supply, and indirectly via changes in climate regulation and disease transmission pathways.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 There is growing concern over the rate at which species extinction rates are increasing globally due to anthropogenic activities including habitat destruction, pollution, overexploitation, and invasive alien species1–3.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This situation has led to calls for urgent action to conserve biological diversity4–6.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite widespread recognition of the importance of conserving biodiversity7–10, there remains considerable uncertainty regarding its role in maintaining ecosystem functions11–13.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A number of theoretical models suggest that biodiversity loss will cause reductions in ecosystem functioning14–16.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, Tilman et al. (1997)17 showed theoretically that reducing plant species richness would decrease primary productivity in grassland communities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Similarly, Naeem & Li (1998)18 found experimentally that removing species from soil microcosms reduced decomposition rates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These predictions were supported by numerous subsequent empirical studies19–22.

 We present the results for positronium ground state energy and wave function obtained by solving relativistic Schrödinger equation with Coulomb potential using variational method.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The calculations are performed within two different approximations, namely nonrelativistic limit (NR) and first order perturbation theory (PT1).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In NR approximation we use Hylleraas type trial wave functions which include spin dependent terms up to second power of inter particle distance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also calculate the expectation value for kinetic energy operator using this wave function.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In PT1 approximation we use Hyllraas type trial wave functions including spin dependent terms up to third power of inter particle distance alongwith one electron Dirac orbitals as basis set.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our calculated values for binding energies agree well with those reported earlier.

 We introduce the notion of ``abstract factorials'', which are functions that can be used to represent and manipulate sets of integers in an efficient manner.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how these functions can been implemented using standard data structures such as hash tables or trees.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we present several applications for this new class as objects including fast algorithms for computing the number of integer partitions with bounded parts (the so-called ``Stirling numbers of the second kind'') and for counting the number of ways to tile a rectangular board with tiles of different sizes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The concept of abstract factorials was introduced along with its implementation on top of existing data structures like hash tables or binary search trees.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Several applications were presented, among them fast algorithms for computing Stirling numbers of the second type and tiling problems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work is supported by NSF grant CCF-0634420.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 1 Introduction To many computational settings it is necessary to perform operations over large collections of integers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, one may need to count the number of ways to partition a set into subsets of equal size, or to compute the number of tilings of a rectangular board with tiles having different shapes and sizes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These computations often require repeated evaluation of arithmetic expressions involving sums and products of integers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has been shown recently that certain classes of such expressions admit very efficient representations based on combinatorial objects known as ``factorials''

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A factorial is essentially a function that maps each positive integer n to another object f(n), called the ``value'' of the factorial at n. Such values can satisfy two properties:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 First, they should form a sequence of nonnegative integers whose sum grows exponentially; i.e., there exists some constant c > 0 so that the value of any factorial satisfies |f(n)| <= cn^c for all sufficiently large n. Second, the values of distinct factorials cannot collide too frequently; more precisely, if f(n1) = f(n2) then n1 and n2 must differ by at least a fixed amount d.

 We study the ground state properties and excitations of the spin-1/2 Heisenberg antiferromagnet on the square lattice with nearest-neighbor interactions only, using exact diagonalization (ED) for small clusters up to 12 sites as well as density-matrix renormalization group (DMRG) calculations for larger systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the ground-state energy per site is lower than the classical value by about 0.25J, where J denotes the exchange coupling constant between neighboring spins.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This indicates strong quantum fluctuations which is also reflected in the low-temperature dependence of the specific heat.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We study entanglement properties of the Toric Code model in two dimensions, which are defined on a square lattice with periodic boundary conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider both ground state and thermal states for this system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we calculate the von Neumann entropy S(A)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 = −TrρA ln ρA associated with different regions A of the lattice as well as the mutual information I(A; B) between any pair of disjoint regions A and B.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results are compared against numerical simulations performed by means of Monte Carlo techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For the ground state it turns out that there exists an area law for the von Neumann entropy, i.e., S(A) ∝ L−d−1 where d denotes the dimension of region A and L its linear size.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, we find that the mutual information decays exponentially fast when one moves away from the diagonal line joining the centers of the regions A and B.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the distribution of the largest fragment in a fragmentation process, which is an important quantity for understanding how to optimize data transmission over networks and storage systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this distribution can be approximated by a power law with exponent 1 + 1/(2 - p), where p is the probability that two fragments merge into one when they are adjacent on disk (the so-called "mergeability parameter").

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result explains why previous studies have found different exponents depending on whether or not merging is allowed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The approximation also allows us to derive closed-form expressions for other quantities such as the mean size of the largest fragment and its variance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we use our results to explain some recent experimental findings about file sizes in peer-to-peer systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In many applications involving data transmission over networks and distributed storage systems, it is useful to understand how large the largest fragment can become during the course of the system's evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if a network node has to transmit a certain amount of information within a given time limit, then knowing what fraction of the total data needs to get transmitted at any point in time may help improve performance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Similarly, in distributed storage systems, knowing the expected size of the largest fragment can determine how much space each node should reserve for storing replicas.

 We study the nonlinear dynamics of infectious diseases transfer in a population, where individuals were divided into three classes: susceptible (S), infected (I) and recovered/removed (R).

 Finally, we show the numerical simulations which illustrate our results.

 The hypercube model is used to describe the evolution of life in terms of its complexity, speed, and stability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The model shows that there are limits imposed by protein stability on how complex an organism can be as well as how fast it evolves molecularly.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It also suggests that these limits may have been reached during the Cambrian explosion about 540 million years ago when most animal phyla appeared simultaneously.

 This article describes the hypercube model and presents some examples of how it has become applied to understand evolutionary processes at different levels of organization ranging from genes to ecosystems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We argue that the evolution of life can be described in three dimensions: complexity, speed, and stabilization.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These three dimensions represent key aspects in biological systems that evolve over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, organisms become more complex through the addition of new components such as organs or tissues; they evolve faster as their genetic variation increases; and they become more stable if mutations do not cause them to die prematurely.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We present an open-source framework, called Bubblesched, that allows to build portable thread schedulers for hierarchical multiprocessors (HMPs).

 We present an alternative description of the electron in terms of its position and velocity, which is based on the idea that it moves along a helical trajectory around the nucleus.

 The new approach leads to a simple analytical expression for the energy levels of the helium atom as well as for the wave functions corresponding to these states.

 We show how this model can been used to explain some experimental results obtained by high-resolution spectroscopy experiments performed at Jefferson Lab.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Helium has been studied extensively over many decades both experimentally and theoretically.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was found that there are two stable isotopes (3He and 4He) and several excited states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These states have been investigated using various spectroscopic techniques including photo-absorption
